title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 May 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Chuguniy> has quit  
00:13 <Denis1> has quit  
00:13 <Inge-> has quit  
00:19 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
00:20 <Inge-\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:20 <Inge-> has quit  
00:22 <vmassol> has quit  
00:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:05 <abusenius> has quit  
03:50 <spawn57\_> has quit  
06:03 <Denis1> has quit  
06:26 <spawn57\_> has joined #xwiki  
06:27 <spawn57\_> hi, can anyone help me with this error? Error installing wiki template. Error number 50035 in 5: Exception in plugin [com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.wikimanager.WikiManagerPlugin]:  
06:47 <spawn57\_> Hi, i'm having trouble creating a multi wiki, can anyone please help me  
08:33 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <spawn57\_> hi, whenver I try to create a subwiki with the WikiManager API, this is the message I see. http://pastebin.com/yqCcgAmF  
09:13 <spawn57\_> hi vmassol, you around?  
09:14 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <mflorea> tmortagne: I think the xwiki-platform-chart build fails due to you last changes to the XWikiRenderingContext  
10:59 <tmortagne> mflorea: checking, thanks  
11:04 <tmortagne> mflorea: what make you think it's related to velocity cache ? I would bet more on vmassol refactoring about temporary images  
11:05 <tmortagne> (which also happen to be the last real commit before the macro start to fail)  
11:05 <mflorea> from the CI it seems indeed that vmassol broke the build, but I don't see how it's commit can affect the chart macro  
11:05 <mflorea> he changed the formula macro and the PDF export  
11:06 <mflorea> Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.velocity.VelocityManager] hint = [default]]  
11:06 <mflorea> and Failed to lookup component [org.xwiki.rendering.internal.transformation.XWikiRenderingContext]  
11:06 <tmortagne> right, I tough he committed his refactoring of temporary image in this commit  
11:07 <tmortagne> mflorea: I see "Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.velocity.VelocityManager] hint = [default]]" in oldore test since forever and I don't see how my commit could have any effect on that  
11:08 <tmortagne> Failed to lookup component [org.xwiki.rendering.internal.transformation.XWikiRenderingContext] probably more but that's weird  
11:08 <tmortagne> it is in the component.txt  
11:08 <tmortagne> lets see what is special about that macro  
11:09 <tmortagne> since if it was not registered probably it would crash pretty much everything  
11:10 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <tmortagne> hmm that's because the macro does not have olcore as dependency I think  
11:12 <tmortagne> looks like oldcore is the only implementation of VelocityManager  
11:15 <tmortagne> not sure if we can sure if we can safely see xwiki-platform-rendering-xwiki as always with oldcore of it I should always test if there is an available VelocityManager  
11:15 <tmortagne> looks like this macro is the only one with a dependency on xwiki-platform-rendering-xwiki without oldcore  
11:16 <tmortagne> that dependency come from display-api  
13:03 <kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <kaisen> Hello, I'm struggling a bit with my own ColorTheme. If I have something in the {{code}} snippet. It is shown with a double dotted line. you can see it here  http://www.bilder-upload.eu/show.php?file=26d987-1400497338.png  I don't know where to edit it as normal on the default theme.  
13:25 <kaisen> Ok I just see that it is on all Themes but with the other colors it doesn't point out so much. But if I want to change it generally - where could I do it  
13:28 <vmassol> kaisen: I don't get any image on http://www.bilder-upload.eu/show.php?file=26d987-1400497338.png  
13:28 <vmassol> oh I do  
13:28 <vmassol> I thought it was advertising ;)  
13:28 <kaisen> Yes is small and not highlighted  
13:28 <vmassol> so what you're after is simply some CSS change  
13:29 <vmassol> which can be done with either a custom skin or better simply a skinextesion  
13:29 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial  
13:30 <kaisen> Thanks thats what I'm looking for :-)  
13:30 <vmassol> (specifically http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial#HMinimalStyleSheeteXtension )  
13:39 <mflorea> sdumitriu, Denis, evalica, tmortagne, vmassol, gdelhumeau: do you have any work uncommitted that is planned for 6.1M1? The release is planned for today.  
13:39 <vmassol> mflorea: nope, it's fine on my side  
13:40 <evalica> mflorea: nope, ty  
13:40 <mflorea> vmassol: I'll move XWIKI-9930 to M2 then  
13:40 <vmassol> indeed, thanks, especially as I'm not active on it right now  
13:41 <vmassol> thanks for the reminder, I had forgotten about it :)  
13:48 <mflorea> tmortagne has two issues in progress, but there are no commits so I guess they can be moved to M2.  
13:51 <mflorea> guys, please don't commit on master in the following hours (unless it's really critical). I'd like to start the release after the CI rebuilds everything.  
13:51 <cjd> mflorea: I totally butchered your wysiwyg :D  http://realtime.webviewers.org/  
13:52 <mflorea> cjd: why do you say so? it looks ok :)  
13:52 <cjd> I'm doing innerHTML transformations under GWT's nose  
13:53 <cjd> with a 700 line html patcher  
13:53 <mflorea> ok :)  
13:54 <cjd> I kind of amazed myself that it worked as well as it did, I just need to change from transforming on the <body> to doing it over the whole <html> and then it will pull in the css and script when a macro is added  
13:56 <mflorea> seem impressive. now, I hope this code won't be thrown away when/if we choose to integrate another WYSIWYG editor..  
13:56 <vmassol> (or that it doesn't require too much maintenance)  
13:57 <vmassol> s/or/and  
13:57 <cjd> mflorea: no, it does html patching under the hood so it actually doesn't touch the wysiwyg API really at all :)  
13:57 <mflorea> good  
13:57 <cjd> vmassol: who me? :D  
13:58 <mflorea> vmassol: the dashboard for 6.1 has some problems and I don't have edit right on it, http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=12290 can you fix it?  
13:58 <vmassol> by maintenance I mean: various browser support and lots of "ifs" to handle all browser quirks :)  
13:58 <vmassol> mflorea: checking  
13:58 <vmassol> permission issue?  
13:59 <cjd> yes indeed, I'm a bit amazed that it works in safari and FF because I did no testing but it seems fairly reliable  
13:59 <vmassol> ah yes  
13:59 <vmassol> forgot to share  
13:59 <vmassol> mflorea: should be better now  
13:59 <mflorea> yep, thanks  
14:10 <tmortagne> mflorea: I removed the fix for  
14:10 <mflorea> tmortagne: thanks  
14:10 <tmortagne> I have tons on things in my TODO list but nothing that would block M1 :)  
14:10 <mflorea> ok :)  
14:31 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: it's ok for me, you can release  
14:32 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: thanks  
14:33 <cjd> vmassol: I need a jira for the realtime core engine (ChainPad) can I just go ahead and register RTCHAINPAD ?  
14:33 <cjd> it's already in the xwiki-contrib repo as chainpad  
14:33 <cjd> (the question is do I have to go back to the list and propose the name RTCHAINPAD before setting it up)  
14:34 <tmortagne> cjd: you really need totaly different projects and repositories for all those realtimes projects ?  
14:35 <cjd> they don't depend on eachother so lumping them together only makes sense to reduce JIRA overhead  
14:35 <cjd> there are valid reasons to want one component and not any other  
14:36 <mflorea> tmortagne: packager-plugin integration tests are failing (you can reproduce locally with -Pintegration-tests) with:  
14:36 <mflorea> Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.xwiki.component.internal.ContextComponentManager cannot be cast to org.xwiki.component.embed.EmbeddableComponentManager  
14:36 <mflorea> does it sound familiar?  
14:38 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <vmassol> cjd: sure, just follow the steps that are documented now :)  
14:43 <cjd> ok thanks  
14:44 <cjd> I'm getting fairly good at those steps  
14:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: that's what I asked cjd  
14:44 <vmassol> IMO it's too hassle to create separate repos/jiras  
14:44 <cjd> re seperate JIRA projects or same... I didn't originally think of same because they're in seperate git repositories, they're installed seperately via the EM  
14:44 <vmassol> cjd: several repos means several versions which means a compatibiltiy matrix  
14:44 <vmassol> and more work for releases  
14:44 <vmassol> it's really a pain  
14:45 <vmassol> better release modules all together even if some have not changed  
14:45 <vmassol> IMO  
14:45 <cjd> I don't see why it's not ok to have one jira for multiple projects now that I think of it..  
14:45 <vmassol> cjd: same thing as repos  
14:45 <vmassol> it's one jira project per release  
14:45 <vmassol> (because of the versions)  
14:46 <cjd> hmm, this is what we had way back before we started releasing platform as a single unit  
14:46 <cjd> now I remember  
14:46 <tmortagne> cjd: if/when they are release are they going to be release together ?  
14:47 <tmortagne> if they are release together with the same version IMO that's the only real thing that matters here  
14:47 <vmassol> cjd: yes we had lots of modules and that was a pain for releases, which is why we moved to a single release  
14:47 <vmassol> (except for contrib projects)  
14:47 <vmassol> now we're thinking about changing that a bit (see the xwiki-extensions email thread) but honestly I'm still worried a bit by the extra work  
14:48 <cjd> I had imagined that there would be many releases to the RTWYSIWYG module and only few to the RTBACKEND  
14:48 <cjd> but I need to add a new message type to ping the server so that requires re-releasing RTBACKEND  
14:49 <cjd> I'll try to keep going this route and if it does become a pain, I'll consider unifying them, although I'd rather not because smaller libraries have some advantages  
14:49 <cjd> (if that makes sense)  
14:56 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, which event is called when comment is added? (DocumentUpdatedEvent?)  
15:01 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:02 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:05 <polx> has quit  
15:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:06 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Hello everyone  
15:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> i would like to ask a question i wasn't able to find in FAQ or via search  
15:10 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:11 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> is it somehow possible to configure a "default class"/template which has to be used for a certain namespace in my xwiki enterprise?  
15:14 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_5: not sure I understand...  
15:15 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> i got some kind of FAQ namespace and user's are able to create pages there  
15:15 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> i would like to force a special page template for each new created document  
15:16 <DarkKnightCZ> you can use Apps within minutes for that  
15:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> there's one special use case also:  
15:17 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> an external application generates links to documents in this namespace ...  
15:17 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> and it may be that the document doesn't exists already (so has to be created newly)....  
15:17 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> and if one now clicks on this link the wiki editor is launched for this "newly" document.  
15:18 <vmassol> so you wish to disable being able to create standard pages in a given space (to force using a defined template - as in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration+Application#HTemplatesCreationandAdministration )  
15:18 <vmassol> (xwikiorg\_guest\_5)  
15:18 <vmassol> the click use case is easy  
15:18 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> ... let me check...  
15:19 <vmassol> what's harder is preventing creation of standard pages in a givne sapce  
15:19 <vmassol> but otherwise the template feature (the link I gave) offers a way to do what you wish and it's also easy to add links/buttons to create pages with a given template too  
15:19 <polx> has quit  
15:21 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> hhmmm  
15:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> yes. the link you gave is for "create new page" button  
15:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> but i don't see solution for "click on link to non existing page" and a "forced template"  
15:23 <vmassol> it's the same actually  
15:24 <vmassol> for "click on link to non existing page"  
15:24 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Administration+Application/CreatePageUsingTemplate1.png  
15:24 <vmassol> (from the same page)  
15:24 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> ah ... now i see.  
15:25 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> thx. so the difficult is to remove the "empty page option" there. right?  
15:25 <vmassol> yes, it's not that hard but it requires changing something not meant to be modified :)  
15:25 <vmassol> (a vm file)  
15:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> :) i see  
15:26 <vmassol> so this means that when you upgrade XWiki to a newer version you'll need to handle a merge  
15:26 <vmassol> (potential merge)  
15:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> argh\*  
15:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> wanna try to avoid this :)  
15:27 <vmassol> although this vm file isn't modified often… but still nicer to do without a change there  
15:27 <vmassol> now  
15:27 <vmassol> you can also override it in a custom skin  
15:27 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <vmassol> but you'll still need to handle a merge in case you wish to benefit from any new change we would do to this file  
15:28 <vmassol> at least you woudl'nt change the file itself…  
15:28 <vmassol> so you won't forget to update it after an upgrade… ;)  
15:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> i get your point.  
15:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> thx for this quick help and the link you gave  
15:29 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Greetings from Salzburg!  
15:29 <vmassol> heh nice ;)  
15:30 <vmassol> and greetings from France (close to Paris) ;)  
15:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has left #xwiki  
15:32 <kaisen> @vmassol did some test with the XWiki Skin Extensions - seems to be the right option for me, just one questions additional to it. How can I use the $theme variables in the StyleSheetExtension?  
15:32 <vmassol> just make sure it's parsed  
15:32 <vmassol> there's an option for that in the JSX  
15:32 <vmassol> (kaisen)  
15:33 <kaisen> ok  
15:33 <vmassol> "Parse Content" set to yes  
15:36 <kaisen> Doesn't change anything. As soon as I add a $theme variable the line is "ignored"  
15:37 <vmassol> need to try it out locally, what variable are you using for example?  
15:38 <kaisen> $theme.backgroundSecondaryColor; and $theme.borderColor;  
15:38 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <kaisen> but I can also put it on the mailing list so you don't need to wast your time  
15:39 <vmassol> maybe you cached it  
15:39 <vmassol> and didn't refresh your cache  
15:40 <kaisen> cache is set to default - so should i delete the browser cache?  
15:43 <vmassol> kaisen: found it  
15:43 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Color+Theme+Application#HUsingColorThemesvariables  
15:44 <vmassol> basically the $theme var is not defined in the velocity ocntext by default, you need to import the definition  
15:47 <kaisen> Yes adding #template('colorThemeInit.vm') and activate parse works ! :-)  
16:03 <msmeria> has quit

18:20 <tmortagne> cjd: updating the page on extensions.xwiki.org would be easier if you publish the extension on maven.xwiki.org  
18:23 <vmassol> it would be a click away :)  
18:23 <mflorea> has quit  
18:24 <cjd> I think I sunk a good week into maven.xwiki.org trying to make a release happen and eventually I gave up  
18:24 <cjd> well.. more like a day but it was an incredibly frustrating day :)  
18:25 <tmortagne> http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HReleasetheproject should do it  
18:25 <cjd> but in general, big +1 for easier releasing  
18:25 <tmortagne> or looking at any other contrib extension  
18:29 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:30 <cjd> maybe too brittle but one can dream  
18:31 <vmassol> we do that…. it's called CI :)  
18:36 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:51 <cjd> http://realtime.webviewers.org/  
18:51 <cjd> lag now displayed in the demo

20:49 <Danilo\_> has joined #xwiki  
20:49 <Danilo\_> Hello  
20:52 <Danilo\_> People, I am planning to develop an extension that will,link and show the documents of a specific wiki. The idea is that the user could explore the document spacially, my ideia is similar to Just map it extension... Well after to search we will use or the sigma.js or d3.js frameworks...  
20:54 <Danilo\_> But, my questions is,  how can I connect into the database of a specific wiiki in order to retrieve the documents and tags informations?  
21:10 <Danilo\_> Do you think that this kind of webservice will work?  
21:10 <Danilo\_> dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/XWikiJSONWebServiceKickStart
